intro: Silene otites var. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered catchfly, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, pinkish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Silene otites var. densiflora is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
